page.title: 06DAIRY FARMS WARDLOW
page.content: { FARMING CRESSBROOK WARDLOW } {DAIRY FARMS }in Wardlow known as { {Meadow,Whitehouse and Gregory }vary from 30-60 hectares.Herds of 20-70 cows comprising Fresian,Ayrshire and mixed breeds,are milked twice daily in cowsheds,but live outside on permanent pasture from May to October.Silage, including big-bale,hay and dairy cake, is fed in winter.Compound fertilizer is applied to the grass each spring, and lime every 2-3 years.These farms are owner occupied,as is one of the 2 dairy farms at Cressbrook.The other is on the Stanton estate.The widely dispersed land of each farm is worked entirely by the families.Surplus bull and heifer calves are sold as week olds at Bakewell market.Milk collected by bulk tanker is taken to Sheffield where it is pasteurised,bottled,and delivered to households daily.
